A dollop of butter, often slightly browned, is placed on top, adding a glossy, golden layer that contrasts with the soup's hue.	<>	Lobster bisque is a creamy, yellowish soup made by simmering lobster shells with butter, cream, and spices until it thickens and becomes smooth. The rich, velvety texture and bright color are enhanced by the inclusion of lobster meat, which adds a luxurious touch. The dish is often garnished with a small mound of lobster meat or a poached egg, creating a visually appealing contrast against the creamy base.	<>	Lobster bisque is a creamy, rich seafood soup made from lobster, onions, butter, cream, and white wine, simmered until smooth and velvety. Its golden-yellow hue and thick consistency are enhanced by a small, fluffy scoop of lobster meat floating on top, creating a luxurious, comforting dish.	<>	Lobster Bisque is a creamy, golden-yellow soup made from lobster stock, cream, and onions, often garnished with a lobster claw or bisque scoop, simmered to perfection, and served in a bowl.	<>	Lobster bisque is a creamy, yellowish soup with a smooth, velvety texture and a rich, savory flavor. It is typically made with lobster meat, cream, and butter, often cooked slowly to meld the flavors and create a luxurious, dense consistency. The dish is often garnished with a dollop of lobster meat in the center, enhancing its visual appeal and adding a touch of elegance.

It's made by simmering lobster meat, cream, and vegetables, creating a luxurious and flavorful broth.	<>	Lobster bisque is a creamy, orange-red soup made by simmering lobster meat, cream, and garlic, often with white wine and a touch of butter. It's typically garnished with fresh parsley and may include lobster claws for texture.	<>	Lobster bisque is a creamy, light orange soup made with lobster, cream, onions, garlic, and possibly white wine or broth. Its rich, orange hue and smooth texture make it visually appealing.
